About Newhaven

Newhaven ferry port, located in Sussex, overlooks the English Channel. Ideally situated between Brighton and Eastbourne, Newhaven links to the ferry port of Dieppe in France.

Getting to Newhaven Ferry Port

By Car

If travelling from Brighton, travel east along the A27 past Lewes and take the A26 to Newhaven. Once in Newhaven follow the signs to Newhaven Ferry Port. The port is located just 64 miles from London, 10 miles (East) from Brighton and 15 miles (west) from Eastbourne.

By Train

Newhaven Town train station is a short walk (3 minutes) from the passenger terminal. Trains operate directly to London, Brighton and Eastbourne. Please do not alight at the Newhaven Harbour station.

By Bus

There is a regular service between Newhaven and Brighton, Peacehaven, Seaford, Bexhill, Folkestone, Dover, Rye and Hastings (routes operated by South Coast Buses and Brighton and Hove buses). National Express also operates a regular service to and from Newhaven from various places across the UK.

Newhaven Ferry Port Facilities

CafÃ©/ Bar

Located inside the terminal building, the 'Haven CafÃ©' serves a large selection of cooked meals, lighter bites, sandwiches as well as hot and cold drinks. The cafÃ© is open everyday from 06.30 - 11.00 and from 18.30 - 22.00.

Disabled Facilities

There is disabled access as well as toilets located inside the terminal building. Assistance with boarding is also available.

Parking at Newhaven Ferry Port

Parking facilities are available just inside the port situated on the left hand side of the terminal building. Tickets can be purchased at the reservation desk in the terminal building and the charge is currently Â£4.50 per 24 hour period. Tickets cannot be pre-booked but it is rare that the car park is full.
